titleStmt.title: A moste necessary treatise of free wil not onlye against the Bapistes, but also against the Anabaptistes, which in these our daies, go about to renue the detestable heresies of Pelagius, and of the Luciferians, whiche say and affirm, that we be able by our own natural strength to fulfil the law and commaundementes of God. Made dialoge wyse by Iohn Veron, in a manner word by woorde, as he did set it forth in his lectures at Paules.
titleStmt.author: Véron, John, d. 1563.

titleStmt.title: A moste necessary treatise of free wil not onlye against the Bapistes, but also against the Anabaptistes, which in these our daies, go about to renue the detestable heresies of Pelagius, and of the Luciferians, whiche say and affirm, that we be able by our own natural strength to fulfil the law and commaundementes of God. Made dialoge wyse by Iohn Veron, in a manner word by woorde, as he did set it forth in his lectures at Paules.
titleStmt.author: Véron, John, d. 1563.

publicationStmt.publisher: By John Tisdale, and are to be sold at his shop in Lombard streate,

notesStmt.note: Place of publication and printer's name and address from colophon; publication date from STC.
Running title reads: Against fre wil men.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
